intro: Erigeron foliosus, commonly known as the leafy fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and white to pale blue. Erigeron foliosus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
